tables.name: adt

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter

fields.name: hospital_id
fields.comment: Assign a unique ID to each hospital within a healthsystem

fields.name: hospital_type
fields.comment: Maps *`hospital_id`* to a standardized list of hospital types

fields.name: in_dttm
fields.comment: Start date and time at a particular location. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: out_dttm
fields.comment: End date and time at a particular location. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: location_name
fields.comment: Location of the patient inside the hospital. This field is used to store the patient location from the source data. It is not used for analysis.

fields.name: location_category
fields.comment: Maps location_name to a standardized list of ADT location categories

fields.name: location_type
fields.comment: Maps ICU type to a standardized list of ICU categories

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: code_status

fields.name: patient_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter

fields.name: start_dttm
fields.comment: The date and time when the specific code status was initiated

fields.name: code_status_name
fields.comment: The name/description of the code status

fields.name: code_status_category
fields.comment: Categorical variable specifying the code status during the hospitalization

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: crrt_therapy

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for hospitalization episode

fields.name: device_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for dialysis machine

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Timestamp when CRRT parameters were recorded

fields.name: crrt_mode_name
fields.comment: Name of CRRT mode (e.g., CVVHDF)

fields.name: crrt_mode_category
fields.comment: Standardized CRRT mode categories

fields.name: dialysis_machine_name
fields.comment: Brand name for the dialysis machine

fields.name: blood_flow_rate
fields.comment: Rate of blood flow through the CRRT circuit (mL/hr)

fields.name: pre_filter_replacement_fluid_rate
fields.comment: Rate of pre-filter replacement fluid infusion (mL/hr)

fields.name: post_filter_replacement_fluid_rate
fields.comment: Rate of post-filter replacement fluid infusion (mL/hr)

fields.name: dialysate_flow_rate
fields.comment: Flow rate of dialysate solution (mL/hr)

fields.name: ultrafilteration_out
fields.comment: Net ultrafiltration output (mL)

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for hospitalization episode", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: ecmo_mcs

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the hospitalization event

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the device settings and/or measurement was recorded

fields.name: device_name
fields.comment: Name of the ECMO/MCS device used including brand information, e.g. Centrimag

fields.name: device_category
fields.comment: Maps device_name to a standardized mCIDE

fields.name: mcs_group
fields.comment: Maps device_category to a standardized mCIDE of MCS types

fields.name: device_metric_name
fields.comment: String that captures the measure of work rate of the device, e.g., RPMs

fields.name: device_rate
fields.comment: Numeric value of work rate, e.g., 3000 RPMs

fields.name: sweep
fields.comment: Gas flow rate in L/min

fields.name: flow
fields.comment: Blood flow in L/min

fields.name: fdO2
fields.comment: Fraction of delivered oxygen

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for the hospitalization event", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: hospitalization

fields.name: patient_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each patient, linking to the patient table

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each hospitalization encounter. Each hospitalization_id represents a unique stay in the hospital

fields.name: hospitalization_joined_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each continuous inpatient stay in a health system which may span different hospitals (Optional)

fields.name: admission_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time the patient is admitted to the hospital. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC

fields.name: discharge_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time the patient is discharged from the hospital. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC

fields.name: age_at_admission
fields.comment: Age of the patient at the time of admission, in years

fields.name: admission_type_name
fields.comment: Type of inpatient admission. Original string from the source data

fields.name: admission_type_category
fields.comment: Admission disposition mapped to mCIDE categories

fields.name: discharge_name
fields.comment: Original discharge disposition name string recorded in the raw data

fields.name: discharge_category
fields.comment: Maps discharge_name to a standardized list of discharge categories

fields.name: zipcode_nine_digit
fields.comment: Patient 9 digit zip code, used to link with other indices such as ADI and SVI

fields.name: zipcode_five_digit
fields.comment: Patient 5 digit zip code, used to link with other indices such as ADI and SVI

fields.name: census_block_code
fields.comment: 15 digit FIPS code

fields.name: census_block_group_code
fields.comment: 12 digit FIPS code

fields.name: census_tract
fields.comment: Full 11 digit FIPS code. Eg. 13089022404 `census_tract` is the state (13) + the county (089) + the census tract (022404).

fields.name: state_code
fields.comment: 2 digit FIPS code

fields.name: county_code
fields.comment: Full 5 digit FIPS code. Eg. 13089 `county_code` is the state (13) + the county (089).

fields.name: fips_version
fields.comment: Year of the Census geography definitions used for the FIPS codes (e.g., 2010, 2020), indicating the tract and boundary set in effect at that time

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for each patient, linking to the patient table", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: hospital_diagnosis

fields.name: diagnosis_code
fields.comment: ICD diagnosis code

fields.name: diagnosis_code_format
fields.comment: Format of the code (e.g., ICD-10-CM, ICD-9-CM)

fields.name: diagnosis_name
fields.comment: Optional human-readable description of the diagnosis

fields.name: diagnosis_type
fields.comment: Type of diagnosis (e.g., Principal, Secondary)

fields.name: present_on_admission
fields.comment: Indicator if the diagnosis was present on admission (Yes/No)

tables.comments: {"description": "Foreign key to the hospitalization table", "permissible": "Must match a hospitalization_id in the hospitalization table"}

tables.name: labs

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter.

fields.name: lab_order_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the lab is ordered. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: lab_collect_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the specimen is collected. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: lab_result_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the lab results are available. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: lab_order_name
fields.comment: Procedure name for the lab, e.g. "Complete blood count w/ diff"

fields.name: lab_order_category
fields.comment: Maps lab_order_name to standardized list of common lab order names, e.g. "CBC"

fields.name: lab_name
fields.comment: Original lab component as recorded in the raw data, e.g. "AST (SGOT)".

fields.name: lab_category
fields.comment: Maps lab_name to a minimum set of standardized labs identified by the CLIF consortium as minimum necessary labs for the study of critical illness.

fields.name: lab_value
fields.comment: Recorded value corresponding to a lab. Lab values are often strings that can contain non-numeric results (e.g. "> upper limit of detection").

fields.name: lab_value_numeric
fields.comment: Parse out numeric part of the lab_value variable (optional).

fields.name: reference_unit
fields.comment: Unit of measurement for that lab.

fields.name: lab_specimen_name
fields.comment: Original fluid or tissue name the lab was collected from as given in the source data

fields.name: lab_specimen_category
fields.comment: Fluid or tissue the lab was collected from, analogous to the LOINC "system" component.

fields.name: lab_loinc_code
fields.comment: [LOINC](https://loinc.org/get-started/loinc-term-basics/) code for the lab

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: medication_admin_continuous

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter

fields.name: admin_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the medicine was administered. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: med_name
fields.comment: Original med name string recorded in the raw data which often contains concentration e.g. NOREPInephrine 8 mg/250 mL

fields.name: med_category
fields.comment: Maps med_name to a limited set of active ingredients for important ICU medications, e.g. norepinephrine

fields.name: med_group
fields.comment: Limited number of ICU medication groups identified by the CLIF consortium, e.g. vasoactives

fields.name: med_route_name
fields.comment: Medicine delivery route

fields.name: med_route_category
fields.comment: Maps med_route_name to a standardized list of medication delivery routes

fields.name: med_dose
fields.comment: Quantity taken in dose

fields.name: med_dose_unit
fields.comment: Unit of dose. It must be a rate, e.g. mcg/min. Boluses should be mapped to med_admin_intermittent

fields.name: mar_action_name
fields.comment: MAR (medication administration record) action, e.g. stopped

fields.name: mar_action_category
fields.comment: Maps mar_action_name to a standardized list of MAR actions

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: microbiology_culture

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter.

fields.name: order_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the test is ordered.

fields.name: collect_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the specimen is collected.

fields.name: result_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the results are available.

fields.name: fluid_name
fields.comment: Cleaned fluid name string from the raw data. This field is not used for analysis.

fields.name: fluid_category
fields.comment: Fluid categories defined according to the NIH common data elements.

fields.name: method_name
fields.comment: Original method names from the source data.

fields.name: method_category
fields.comment: Maps method_name to a standardized list of method categories.

fields.name: organism_category
fields.comment: Cleaned organism name string from the raw data. This field is not used for analysis.

fields.name: organism_group
fields.comment: Maps organism_name to the standardized list of organisms in the NIH CDE.

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter.", "permissible": ""}

tables.name: microbiology_nonculture

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.

fields.name: result_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the non-culture result was obtained. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: collect_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the sample was collected. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: order_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the test was ordered. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: fluid_name
fields.comment: Name of the fluid sample.

fields.name: component_category
fields.comment: Category of the component tested.

fields.name: result_unit_category
fields.comment: Unit category of the test result.

fields.name: result_category
fields.comment: Category of the test result.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: patient_assessments

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Primary Identifier. Unique identifier linking assessments to a specific patient hospitalization.

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: The exact date and time when the assessment was recorded, ensuring temporal accuracy. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: assessment_name
fields.comment: Assessment Tool Name. The primary name of the assessment tool used (e.g., GCS, NRS, SAT Screen).

fields.name: assessment_category
fields.comment: Maps assessment_name to a standardized list of patient assessments

fields.name: assessment_group
fields.comment: Broader Assessment Group. This groups the assessments into categories such as Sedation, Neurologic, Pain, etc.

fields.name: numerical_value
fields.comment: Numerical Assessment Result. The numerical result or score from the assessment component.

fields.name: categorical_value
fields.comment: Categorical Assessment Result. The categorical outcome from the assessment component.

fields.name: text_value
fields.comment: Textual Assessment Result. The textual explanation or notes from the assessment component.

tables.comments: {"description": "Primary Identifier. Unique identifier linking assessments to a specific patient hospitalization.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: patient

fields.name: patient_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each patient. This is presumed to be a distinct individual.

fields.name: race_name
fields.comment: Patient race string from source data

fields.name: race_category
fields.comment: A standardized CDE description of patient race per the US Census

fields.name: ethnicity_name
fields.comment: Patient ethnicity string from source data

fields.name: ethnicity_category
fields.comment: Description of patient ethnicity per the US census definition

fields.name: sex_name
fields.comment: Patient’s biological sex as given in the source data

fields.name: sex_category
fields.comment: Patient biological sex

fields.name: birth_date
fields.comment: Patient’s date of birth

fields.name: death_dttm
fields.comment: Patient’s death date, including time

fields.name: language_name
fields.comment: Patient’s preferred language

fields.name: language_category
fields.comment: Maps language_name to a standardized list of spoken languages

tables.comments: {"description": "Primary Identifier. Unique identifier linking assessments to a specific patient hospitalization.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: position

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter. This table only includes those encounters that have proning documented ever.

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the vital is recorded. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: position_name
fields.comment: Description of the position from the source data. This field is not used for analysis.

fields.name: position_category
fields.comment: Maps position_name to either prone or not prone.

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter. This table only includes those encounters that have proning documented ever.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: respiratory_support

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the device settings and/or measurement was recorded. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: device_name
fields.comment: Raw string of the device. Not used for analysis.

fields.name: device_id
fields.comment: ID variable for device used

fields.name: device_category
fields.comment: Maps device_name to a standardized list of respiratory support device categories

fields.name: vent_brand_name
fields.comment: Ventilator model name when device_category is IMV or NIPPV

fields.name: mode_name
fields.comment: Raw string of ventilation mode (e.g., CMV volume control)

fields.name: mode_category
fields.comment: Standardized list of modes of mechanical ventilation

fields.name: tracheostomy
fields.comment: Indicates if tracheostomy is present

fields.name: fio2_set
fields.comment: Fraction of inspired oxygen set (e.g., 0.21)

fields.name: lpm_set
fields.comment: Liters per minute set

fields.name: tidal_volume_set
fields.comment: Tidal volume set (in mL)

fields.name: resp_rate_set
fields.comment: Respiratory rate set (in bpm)

fields.name: pressure_control_set
fields.comment: Pressure control set (in cmH2O)

fields.name: pressure_support_set
fields.comment: Pressure support set (in cmH2O)

fields.name: flow_rate_set
fields.comment: Flow rate set

fields.name: peak_inspiratory_pressure_set
fields.comment: Peak inspiratory pressure set (in cmH2O)

fields.name: inspiratory_time_set
fields.comment: Inspiratory time set (in seconds)

fields.name: peep_set
fields.comment: Positive-end-expiratory pressure set (in cmH2O)

fields.name: tidal_volume_obs
fields.comment: Observed tidal volume (in mL)

fields.name: resp_rate_obs
fields.comment: Observed respiratory rate (in bpm)

fields.name: plateau_pressure_obs
fields.comment: Observed plateau pressure (in cmH2O)

fields.name: peak_inspiratory_pressure_obs
fields.comment: Observed peak inspiratory pressure (in cmH2O)

fields.name: peep_obs
fields.comment: Observed PEEP (in cmH2O)

fields.name: minute_vent_obs
fields.comment: Observed minute ventilation (in liters)

fields.name: mean_airway_pressure_obs
fields.comment: Observed mean airway pressure

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: vitals

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: ID variable for each patient encounter.

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the vital is recorded. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: vital_name
fields.comment: Description of the flowsheet measure from the source data. Not used for analysis.

fields.name: vital_category
fields.comment: Maps vital_name to a list of standard vital sign categories.

fields.name: vital_value
fields.comment: Recorded value of the vital. Measurement unit should match the vital category.

fields.name: meas_site_name
fields.comment: Site where the vital is recorded. Optional field with no associated category.

tables.comments: {"description": "ID variable for each patient encounter.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: intake_output

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.

fields.name: intake_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time of intake. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: fluid_name
fields.comment: Name of the fluid administered.

fields.name: amount
fields.comment: Amount of fluid administered (in mL)

fields.name: in_out_flag
fields.comment: Indicator for intake or output (1 for intake, 0 for output)

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: invasive_hemodynamics

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier linking to the specific hospitalization.

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: The date and time when the measurement was recorded. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: measure_name
fields.comment: Description of the site or context of the invasive hemodynamic measurement.

fields.name: measure_category
fields.comment: Categorical variable specifying the type of invasive hemodynamic measurement.

fields.name: measure_value
fields.comment: The numerical value of the invasive hemodynamic measurement in mmHg.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier linking to the specific hospitalization.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: key_icu_orders

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier linking the order to a specific hospitalization.

fields.name: order_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the order was placed. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: order_name
fields.comment: Name of the specific order (e.g., PT Evaluation, OT Treatment).

fields.name: order_category
fields.comment: Category of the order.

fields.name: order_status_name
fields.comment: Status of the order.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier linking the order to a specific hospitalization.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: medication_admin_intermittent

fields.name: N
fields.comment: This is a placeholder column. See documentation above for schema details.

tables.comments: {"description": "This is a placeholder column. See documentation above for schema details.", "permissible": ""}

tables.name: medication_orders

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each hospitalization, linking medication orders to a specific encounter

fields.name: med_order_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each medication order

fields.name: order_start_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the medication order was initiated. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: order_end_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the medication order ended or was discontinued. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: ordered_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the medication was actually ordered. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: med_name
fields.comment: Name of the medication ordered

fields.name: med_category
fields.comment: Maps med_name to a list of permissible medication names

fields.name: med_group
fields.comment: Limited number of medication groups identified by the CLIF consortium

fields.name: med_order_status_name
fields.comment: Status of the medication order, e.g. held, given

fields.name: med_order_status_category
fields.comment: Maps med_order_status_name to a standardized list of medication order statuses

fields.name: med_route_name
fields.comment: Route of administration for the medication

fields.name: med_dose
fields.comment: Dosage of the medication ordered

fields.name: med_dose_unit
fields.comment: Unit of measurement for the medication dosage

fields.name: med_frequency
fields.comment: Frequency with which the medication is administered, as per the order

fields.name: prn
fields.comment: Indicates whether the medication is to be given as needed (PRN)

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for each hospitalization, linking medication orders to a specific encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: patient_procedures

fields.name: patient_id
fields.comment: Uniquely identifies a patient.

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Uniquely identifies a hospitalization event for the patient.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.comment: Uniquely identifies the provider associated with the procedure.

fields.name: procedure_code
fields.comment: Encoded procedure identifier (e.g., CPT, ICD-10-PCS, SNOMED code).

fields.name: procedure_code_format
fields.comment: Code format used (e.g., CPT, ICD-10-PCS, SNOMED).

fields.name: recorded_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time the procedure was performed or recorded. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

tables.comments: {"description": "Uniquely identifies a patient.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: place_based_index

fields.name: index_name
fields.comment: The name of the index (e.g., Area Deprivation Index, Social Vulnerability Index).

fields.name: index_value
fields.comment: The numerical value of the index for the given hospitalization.

fields.name: index_version
fields.comment: Version of the index used (e.g., ADI 2019, SVI 2020).

tables.comments: {"description": "Foreign key linking to the hospitalization table.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: provider

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each hospitalization, linking the provider to a specific encounter

fields.name: provider_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for each provider. This represents individual healthcare providers

fields.name: start_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the provider’s care or involvement in the patient’s case began. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: stop_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the provider’s care or involvement in the patient’s case ended. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: provider_role_name
fields.comment: The original string describing the role or specialty of the provider during the hospitalization

fields.name: provider_role_category
fields.comment: Maps provider_role_name to list of standardized provider roles

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for each hospitalization, linking the provider to a specific encounter", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: microbiology_susceptibility

fields.name: organism_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the organism tested for antimicrobial susceptibility

fields.name: antibiotic_name
fields.comment: Name of the antibiotic tested for susceptibility

fields.name: antibiotic_category
fields.comment: Category or class of the antibiotic tested

fields.name: sensitivity_name
fields.comment: Original result of the sensitivity test as reported by the laboratory

fields.name: susceptibility_name
fields.comment: Standardized interpretation of the susceptibility result

fields.name: susceptibility_category
fields.comment: Standardized category of susceptibility.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for the organism tested for antimicrobial susceptibility", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: therapy_details

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.

fields.name: session_start_dttm
fields.comment: Date and time when the therapy session started. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: therapy_element_name
fields.comment: Name of the therapy element.

fields.name: therapy_element_category
fields.comment: Category of the therapy element.

fields.name: therapy_element_value
fields.comment: Value associated with the therapy element.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier for the hospitalization event.", "permissible": "No restriction"}

tables.name: transfusion

fields.name: hospitalization_id
fields.comment: Unique identifier linking the transfusion event to a specific hospitalization in the CLIF database.

fields.name: transfusion_start_dttm
fields.comment: The date and time the transfusion of the blood component began. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: transfusion_end_dttm
fields.comment: The date and time the transfusion of the blood component ended. All datetime variables must be timezone-aware and set to UTC.

fields.name: component_name
fields.comment: The name of the blood component transfused.

fields.name: attribute_name
fields.comment: Attributes describing modifications to the component.

fields.name: volume_transfused
fields.comment: The volume of the blood component transfused.

fields.name: volume_units
fields.comment: The unit of measurement for the transfused volume.

fields.name: product_code
fields.comment: ISBT 128 Product Description Code representing the specific blood product.

tables.comments: {"description": "Unique identifier linking the transfusion event to a specific hospitalization in the CLIF database.", "permissible": "No restriction"}
